title.narrative: INCREASING PARTICIPATION

description.narrative: Young people have participation platforms and increased capacities to amplify their voices be connected, actively engaged, empowered to actively and productively participate in their communities and society, which contributes to Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas (Covid), Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, young people, particularly the most vulnerable and marginalized, have increased knowledge, skills and opportunities to practise healthy lifestyles, participate in decision-making and make the transition to working life

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Young people have participation platforms and increased capacities to amplify their voices; be connected, actively engaged,empowered to actively and productively participate in their communities and society

description.narrative: Important steps to further strengthen the policy and legal frameworks on youth participation were taken this year. UNICEF supported the revisions of the Law on Volunteering, contributed to the development of the new National Youth Strategy and new youth participation standards, and expanded U-Report as a tool for making the voices of all young people heard by reaching out to young people with disabilities. The globally acknowledged U-Report initiative continued aggregating youth opinions, and a total of 17 U-Report polls with inputs from 10,000 young persons were conducted in 2021.;; | Status:Met | As-of Date:08/12/2021
